title: Layout Customization and Stability Improvements
description: Holiday release focused entirely on bug fixes and stability improvements across core agent, layout controls, and code diff viewing. Introduced four default layouts (agent, editor, zen, browser) with keyboard shortcuts for switching. Added enterprise features including conversation insights, billing groups, service accounts, and Linux sandboxing for agents.

community_feedback.quote: Getting tired of the UI changes - the layout keeps getting rearranged - file tree moving around
Our goal here is to make it easy for you to customize your default layout, and which panes you want open
Is there a way to change back to the old layout?

title: Aider v0.86.0 - GPT-5 and Grok-4 Support
description: Added comprehensive support for all GPT-5 models across family variants and providers (OpenAI, Azure, OpenRouter), including dated versions. Added support for Grok-4 via xai/grok-4 and openrouter/x-ai/grok-4 model names. Disabled temperature parameter when using GPT-5 models. Aider wrote 88% of the code in this release.

community_feedback.quote: Aider wrote 88% of the code in this release

title: v0.21.0-nightly.20251216 - Policy Engine and Authentication Improvements
description: Refresh hooks when refreshing extensions, added clarity to error messages, disallowed redundant typecasts. Fixed authentication to prioritize GEMINI_API_KEY environment variable and skip unnecessary key validation. Added hashed_extension_name to telemetry fields for extension events. Improved policy engine documentation and defaults.

community_feedback.quote: 5 people reacted with thumbs up emoji

title: v0.21.0-preview.5 through v0.21.0-nightly.20251211 - Multiple Preview and Nightly Releases
description: Rapid release cycle with multiple preview and nightly builds featuring persistent 'Always Allow' policies with granular shell & MCP support, multi-file drag and drop of images, settings validation schema, /init command for a2a server, IDE extension auth token improvements, and various bug fixes.

community_feedback.quote: 12 people reacted with thumbs up, laugh, hooray, heart, and rocket emojis

title: v0.20.2 and v0.20.1 - Stable Patch Releases
description: Two stable patch releases (v0.20.2 and v0.20.1) with critical bug fixes cherry-picked from nightly builds to address subagent invocation issues and other bugs.

community_feedback.quote: 8 people reacted with thumbs up, hooray, heart, and rocket emojis

title: Visual Studio 2026 Response and Git Workflow Improvements
description: Microsoft improved Copilot responses in Visual Studio 2026 through additional context injected into chats, with responses described as 'dramatically improved'. New Git workflow features including fast branch switches, visual diffs, Copilot commits, AI reviews, and inline comments.

community_feedback.quote: Visual Studio 2026 copilot experience is horrible - broken markdown rendering in chat responses
Copilot Squad feature is not just ChatGPT inside the IDE but a team of specialized participants

title: codex-mini-latest Model Deprecation Notice
description: OpenAI notified developers that the codex-mini-latest model will be deprecated and removed from the API on January 16, 2026. This is a significant change affecting developers using this model.
